definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: After accomplishing those tasks, the paratroopers had to withstand any German counterattacks.
sentences.chinese: 完成這些任務之後，傘兵還必須頂住德軍的反攻。

sentences.english: Rebels have been trying to fight off a counter-offensive by Gaddafi forces.
sentences.chinese: 反政府武裝一直試圖擊退由卡扎菲部隊反攻。

sentences.english: During the Alliance push to defeat the Horde, Blackrock was besieged by human forces.
sentences.chinese: 當聯盟大反攻時黑石塔受到人類的圍攻。

sentences.english: The object of strategic retreat is to conserve military strength and prepare for the counter- offensive.
sentences.chinese: 戰略退卻的目的是爲了保存軍力，準備反攻。

sentences.english: The Baggies immediately bounced back, however, and had a goal disallowed for offside, shortly before actually equalising from the penalty spot.
sentences.chinese: 西布朗很快反攻，不過他們的進球因爲越位不算。

sentences.english: Joint US Japan, counterattack against the mainland, save one billion three hundred million people.
sentences.chinese: 聯合美日，反攻大陸，解救十三億中國人。

sentences.english: Furthermore, the Johnson Administration put Taiwan's Plan for attacking the mainland plan aside.
sentences.chinese: 此外，約翰遜政府最終擱置了臺灣反攻大陸的計劃。

sentences.english: He said he would continue working on a second volume of memoirs, to be called The Final Strategic Counteroffensive.
sentences.chinese: 他說將繼續寫作回憶錄的第二卷《最後的戰略反攻》。

sentences.english: But just for 1 hour, the Russians counterattacked, and forced my Kompanie out again.
sentences.chinese: 但是一小時後，蘇聯人發動了反攻重新奪回了陣地。

sentences.english: From now on the whole country must make "preparation for the counter-offensive" its over-all task in the War of Resistance.
sentences.chinese: 從現時起，全國應以“準備反攻”爲抗戰的總任務。

sentences.english: After this careful preparation Tien Tan felt the time was right to launch his counter attack.
sentences.chinese: 在經過精心的策劃後，田單認爲反攻的時機到了。

sentences.english: Allies launch successful counter-offensives at the Marne and Amiens.
sentences.chinese: 盟國發射成功反攻在馬恩和亞眠。

sentences.english: During the summer counterattack that lasted for one week, the soldiers had used up all the ammunition.
sentences.chinese: 在長達一週的夏季反攻中，士兵們用盡了彈藥。

sentences.english: All of these things greatly surprised me, but especially the counter-offensive.
sentences.chinese: 這些事件很使我感到震驚，尤其是八路軍的轉入反攻。

sentences.english: Another reason was that the objective situation compelled us to start the counteroffensive at an early date.
sentences.chinese: 另一個原因是客觀形勢迫使我們要早反攻。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
